{"step_by_step_thinking": "Occlusal trauma refers to the damage to teeth, periodontium, or other oral structures due to excessive or abnormal forces applied to the teeth. The common signs of occlusal trauma include tooth mobility, sensitivity to pressure, pain, and changes in the periodontium such as widening of the periodontal ligament space. Fractures of cusps and resorption of alveolar ridge are not typically associated with occlusal trauma.", "answer_choice": "A. Tooth mobility, D. Widening of P.D ligament"}
